MRAM Recovery Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides MRAM (Magnetic Random Access Memory) recovery functionality for Apollo5 devices. It supports application-initiated MRAM recovery operations, status monitoring, and system reset capabilities for memory recovery and system maintenance.

Key Features

  1. MRAM Recovery: Application-initiated MRAM recovery operations.
  2. Status Monitoring: Real-time MRAM recovery status tracking.
  3. System Reset: Controlled system reset for recovery operations.
  4. Key Validation: Secure key-based recovery authorization.
  5. Chip Compatibility: Support for specific chip revisions.

Functionality

  • Initialize MRAM recovery operations
  • Monitor MRAM recovery status
  • Handle system reset for recovery
  • Validate recovery keys and authorization
  • Support chip-specific recovery operations

Usage

  1. Initialize recovery using am_hal_mram_recovery_init_app_recovery()
  2. Monitor recovery status with am_hal_mram_recovery_read_status()
  3. Handle recovery operations and system reset
  4. Validate recovery keys and authorization
  5. Monitor recovery progress and completion

Configuration

  • Recovery Keys: Configure secure recovery authorization keys
  • System Reset: Set up system reset parameters for recovery
  • Chip Support: Configure chip-specific recovery parameters
  • Status Monitoring: Set up recovery status tracking

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_mram_recovery_init_app_recovery()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_recovery_init_app_recovery ( uint32_t ui32Key,
bool bReset )

Writes the Application Initiated MRAM Recovery key to OTA pointer. Need to call POI for initiating MRAM Recovery.

Parameters
ui32Key- The key to write to the OTA Pointer register. bReset - Set to true if a reset is needed after writing the key
Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure.

◆ am_hal_mram_recovery_read_status()

uint32_t am_hal_mram_recovery_read_status ( am_hal_mram_recovery_status_t * psStatus)

Reads the MRAM Recovery Status register.

Parameters
pui32Status- Pointer to the location to store the status.
Returns
0 for success, non-zero for failure.
